name: KP Bump Eraser Body Scrub with 10% AHA – Body Exfoliant for Keratosis Pilaris
categories: Bath & Body, Bath & Shower, Scrub & Exfoliants
about: What it is:  A body scrub that sweeps away dry, rough bumps associated with KP & strawberry skin to reveal healthier looking skin that feels exceptionally smooth...Skin Type: Normal, Dry, and Combination..Skincare Concerns: Dryness, Pores, and Dullness and Uneven Texture..Formulation: Scrub..Highlighted Ingredients:.- Pumice Buffing Beads: Exfoliate particles to remove dead cells..- Glycolic and Lactic Acids: Exfoliate to help skin appear bright..- Bisabolol: Soothes skin...Ingredient Callouts: This product is vegan, cruelty-free, and gluten-free, and comes in recyclable packaging...What Else You Need to Know: Safe for sensitive skin, this fast-acting body scrub uses Glycolic & Lactic acids, at a combined level of 10% AHAs, to help resurface skin’s top layer + Pumice to physically exfoliate, helping improve skin’s texture and smooth away bumps, roughness, and scaly areas, also known as chicken skin + buttne...Clinical Results:  In a consumer perception test with 38 participants, after 10 days:.- 92% of panelists with KP reported that this product made their skin feel exceptionally smooth..- 95% of panelists with KP reported that this product made their skin feel softer than it had ever been..-  95% reported it got rid of dry, flakey skin
ingredients: -Pumice Buffing Beads: Exfoliate particles to remove dead cells. .-Glycolic and Lactic Acids: Exfoliate to help skin appear bright..-Bisabolol: Soothes skin...Pumice, Water, Glycolic Acid, Sodium Cocoyl Isethionate, Lactic Acid, Dimethicone, Stearic Acid, Cetearyl Alcohol, Sodium Hydroxide, Palmitic Acid, Glycerin, C12-15 Alkyl Benzoate, Sorbitol, Colloidal Oatmeal, Tocopherol, Chrysanthemum Parthenium (Feverfew) Extract, Camellia Sinensis Leaf Extract, Glycyrrhiza Glabra (Licorice) Root Extract, Salix Nigra (Willow) Bark Extract, Bisabolol, Hydrogenated Coconut Acid, Xanthan Gum, Steareth-20, Steareth-21, Myristic Acid, Sodium Isethionate, Phenoxyethanol, Potassium Sorbate, Sodium Benzoate, Leuconostoc/Radish Root Ferment Filtrate, EDTA.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage: .-Use one to two times a week as tolerated. .-Apply onto wet skin and gently massage with fingertips onto problem areas. .-Rinse and pat dry. .-Follow with moisturizer. .. Precautions:.-Avoid contact with eyes. If contact occurs, rinse well with water. .-If irritation persists, discontinue use and consult a physician..-Not intended for facial use. .-Use only as directed..-Keep out of reach of children. .-Anyone can use this product. A patch test is recommended for those with sensitive skin..-This product contains glycolic and lactic acids that may increase your skin’s sensitivity to the sun and particularly the possibility of sunburn. Use sunscreen, wear protective clothing, and limit sun exposure while using this product and for a week afterwards.

I think the fine grain really helps to get in the skin without too much trauma and irritation to the skin. Highly highly recommend! Never been so satisfied with a product before :)

reviews.review_title: Excellent product but must use routinely
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I was recommended this specific brand and product by my dermatologist when I asked what the bumps were on my arms and back of my legs. She said use this and any kind of cream with extra salicylic acid (she recommended Cerave Rough and Bumpy).  I have skin that's a little more on the drier side and I live in New England with long, dry winters (8 months of heating our homes ><). I have to be careful with exfoliating and moisturizing routines that can make my dry skin worse for that reason.  All that being said, this product works REALLY well for me at controlling the keratosis pilaris I have on my arms and back of my legs. And it does so without drying my skin out or causing any other side effects. I generally use this every other day. Sometimes with the Cerave and sometimes without (if I forget or am running late). If I skip a few uses of this scrub, I can tell the difference. So, it's important that you keep consistency to see the consistent results. But I feel this is totally worth the money!    Also, I enjoy that a little bit of product goes a long way. I use about a nickel sized amount for my upper arms and the back of my legs. So if you (like me) are thinking it's too pricey, please know that it lasts a long time and doesn't take a lot of product to be super effective!
only thing that got rid of my bumps, redness is still there a little but going away. saw results after 1-2 weeks.

reviews.review_title: First Aid Beauty KP Bump Eraser Body Scrub: A Scru
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I am compelled to share my underwhelming experience with First Aid Beauty's KP Bump Eraser Body Scrub with 10% AHA, a product that has fallen short of its promises and has raised concerns about the brand's quality and customer service. Additionally, I'd like to highlight the issue of missing samples, further adding to my disappointment.  Having heard positive feedback about First Aid Beauty, I had high hopes for their KP Bump Eraser Body Scrub. Unfortunately, my experience has left me far from impressed.  The scrub itself failed to live up to its claims of effectively exfoliating and improving the appearance of keratosis pilaris (KP) and rough skin. Despite using the product consistently, I noticed minimal improvement in the texture of my skin. The scrub's effectiveness was questionable at best, and its gritty texture felt harsh and abrasive on my skin.  Additionally, the fragrance of the scrub was overpowering and unpleasant, making the overall application experience far from enjoyable. This lack of attention to sensory details further diminished my confidence in the product's quality.  Equally concerning was the issue of missing samples. As a customer, I had expected to receive the promised samples along with my purchase. However, upon receiving my order, I was disappointed to find that the samples were nowhere to be found. This oversight is particularly disappointing considering that samples are often an incentive for customers to try additional products from the brand.  Furthermore, when I reached out to First Aid Beauty's customer service to address both the ineffectiveness of the product and the missing samples, I received a lackluster response that did not adequately address my concerns. This dismissive approach to customer inquiries further raises questions about the brand's commitment to customer satisfaction.  In summary, my experience with First Aid Beauty's KP Bump Eraser Body Scrub with 10% AHA has been underwhelming at best. Subpar effectiveness, an ov

reviews.review_text: I’ve had this product for almost a month now, maybe even longer. I’ve been using it to get rid of my Keratosis Pilaris (also known as “strawberry skin”) and haven’t seen much results. The only thing I’ve noticed is that my skin has gotten a lot itchier and a lot more red. The bottle smells like vomit too, this is my first time buying it so I’m not sure what it’s supposed to smell like and I’m not sure if this is normal for it to smell unpleasant. I most likely won’t be buying again, had high expectations due to the good reviews but I haven’t had a good experience. Everyone’s skin is different though, so you may have to try it yourself.  - Alex :)
